profile.title: PhD Student
profile.bio: I am a PhD Computer Science student at North Carolina State University advised by Dr. Anupam Das. I am a member of the Wolfpack Security and Privacy Research (WSPR) Lab at NC State's Computer Science department. Previously, I graduated with BS(CS) from Lahore University of Management Sciences in 2020.

news.text: Our paper "Privacy by Voice: Designing Usable Privacy Notices for the Voice Interface" has been accepted at PETS 2026!
Our paper "PriVA-C: Defending Voice Assistants from Fingerprinting Attacks" received the Best Paper Runner-Up Award at PETS 2026!

research.description: My research focuses on security and privacy, particularly in the context of smart home devices and voice assistants. I examine how these systems interact with user expectations and behaviors, with a focus on understanding the gap between user mental models and actual system behavior.

interests.title: Voice Assistant Security & Privacy
interests.detail: Investigating fingerprinting attacks on voice assistants, defending against traffic analysis, and understanding misactivation behavior.

interests.title: Smart Home Ecosystems
interests.detail: Analyzing ad prevalence and compliance in Alexa Skills, studying user perception and awareness of third-party ecosystem risks.

interests.title: User-Centered Security
interests.detail: Understanding attitudes towards IoT adoption, investigating harassment and safety mechanisms in VR, and analyzing ad-tracking inference processes.
